result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Guidice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Count 6 and Consecutive to Federal sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $167,915.46 to be be paid to the following:  $166,915.46 to be paid to Federal Insurance Co. and $1,000.00 to be paid to Novum.  Restitution to be paid during term of incarceration and during extended supervision.

Costs in the amount of $1,220.67 to be paid to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office for costs of transportation.  Costs to be paid during term of incarceration and during extended supervision.
Court Costs and DNA Surcharge waived.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant must not possess, procure, purchase or otherwise obtain access to any form of computer network, bulletin board, Internet, or exchange format involving computers unless specifically approved by Agent.

Defendant must submit to an initial inspection by the Agent, and to any unannounced examinations during supervision, of any computer equipment he may use.  This includes, but is not limited to, personal computer, personal digital assistants, entertainment consoles, cellular telephones, and/or any electronic media device which is owned or accessed by him.  Defendant must allow the installation on his computer of any hardware or software systems which monitor computer use.  Defendant must pay the costs of the computer monitoring program.

Defendant is prohibited from incurring any new credit charges, opening additional lines of credit, or incurring any new monetary loan, obligation, or debt, by whatever name known, without the approval of his Agent.

Upon request, defendant must provide his Agent with full disclosure of his financial records, including co-mingled income, expenses, assets and liabilities, to include yearly income tax returns.  Defendant is prohibited from maintaining and/or opening any additional individual and/or joint checking, savings, or other financial accounts, for either personal or business purposes, without the knowledge and approval of his Agent.

Defendant must not enter any gambling establishment without the permission of his Agent.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Supervision may be transferred to whatever state defendant is living in upon release from incarceration.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Guidice in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff. Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously found guilty of Counts # 1 and 6. State makes recommendations. Attorney Wolff makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following for Count # 1:

Concurrent to Count # 6. Consecutive to federal sentence.

Imposed Sentence of:

10 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days)
-	5 Years of Initial Confinement
-	5 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision: Supervision may be transferred to whatever state defendant is living in upon release from incarceration.

- Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

- Defendant must not possess, procure, purchase or otherwise obtain access to any form of computer network, bulletin board, Internet, or exhange format involving computers unless specifically approved by his agent;

- Defendant must submit to an initial inspection by the agent, and to any unannounced examinations during supervision, of any computer equipment he may use. This includes, but is not limited to, personal computer, personal digital assistants, entertainment consoles, cellular telephones, and/or any electronic media device which is owned or accessed by him. Defendant must allow the installation on his computer of any hardware or software systems which monitor computer use. Defendant must pay the costs of the computer monitoring program;

- Defendant is prohibited from incurring any new credit charges, opening additional lines of credit, or incurring any new monetary loan, obligation, or debt, by whatever name known, without the approval of his agent;

- Upon request, defendant must provide his agent with full disclosure of his financial records, including co-mingled income, expenses, assets and liabilities, to include yearly income tax returns. Defendant is prohibited from maintaining and/or opening any additional individual and/or joint checking, savings, or other financial accounts, for either personal or business purposes, without the knowledge and approval of his agent;

- Defendant must not enter any gambling establishment without the permission of his agent;

Restitution: $1,220.67 to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office for costs of transportation.

Restitution: $1,000.00 to Novum.

Restitution: $166,915.46 to Federal Insurance Co.

All restitution to be paid during term of incarceration and during extended supervision.

COSTS: WAIVED

DNA surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Defendant to be remanded back to federal authorities forthwith.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

***************

The Court Orders the Following for Count # 6:

Concurrent to Count # 1. Consecutive to federal sentence.

Imposed Sentence of:

6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days)
-	3 Years of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision: Supervision may be transferred to whatever state defendant is living in upon release from incarceration.

- Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

- Defendant must not possess, procure, purchase or otherwise obtain access to any form of computer network, bulletin board, Internet, or exhange format involving computers unless specifically approved by his agent;

- Defendant must submit to an initial inspection by the agent, and to any unannounced examinations during supervision, of any computer equipment he may use. This includes, but is not limited to, personal computer, personal digital assistants, entertainment consoles, cellular telephones, and/or any electronic media device which is owned or accessed by him. Defendant must allow the installation on his computer of any hardware or software systems which monitor computer use. Defendant must pay the costs of the computer monitoring program;

- Defendant is prohibited from incurring any new credit charges, opening additional lines of credit, or incurring any new monetary loan, obligation, or debt, by whatever name known, without the approval of his agent;

- Upon request, defendant must provide his agent with full disclosure of his financial records, including co-mingled income, expenses, assets and liabilities, to include yearly income tax returns. Defendant is prohibited from maintaining and/or opening any additional individual and/or joint checking, savings, or other financial accounts, for either personal or business purposes, without the knowledge and approval of his agent;

- Defendant must not enter any gambling establishment without the permission of his agent;

COSTS: WAIVED

DNA surcharge: WAIVED

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Defendant to be remanded back to federal authorities forthwith.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Jerry Guidice in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1 and #6. Counts #2-5 are dismissed and read in. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #1 and #6. State requests a Pre Sentence Investigation. Atty. Wolff advises that there has been a Federal Pre Sentence Investigation done and requests that Atty. Boese review that document before the Court orders a Pre Sentence Investigation. Court will order a Pre Sentence Investigation if informed to do so by the parties. Parties to advise the Court withing 10 days as to whether or not a Pre Sentence Investigation is required. Atty. Wolff requests sentencing on another date. Court sets.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 12, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Need to consult Ms. Boese on that issue.** D.A. Boese reached victim by telephone 5/12/17, victim does not want to appear at plea hearing. Plea hearing set for 5/12/17 at 11:00am.
